website_summaries.verdict: D-Link's Wi-Fi AC750 Portable Router and Charger (DIR-510L) is a handy traveling companion that allows you to create an instant wireless network with hotspots, wired Internet, and cellular connections. Plus, it can charge your mobile devices.
cons: During testing, SharePort Web Access did not open in Internet Explorer 11

customer_reviews.title: This D-Link Unit Meets All Its Specs.
customer_reviews.text: This D-Link Wi-Fi AC750 portable router delivers up to stated specs. In comparison, months ago, I bought a similar unit, but not AC, just the N standard, supposedly, N 300. But my Wi-Fi software reports it is N 150, the unit is a Chinese brand and manufacturer. Both units deliver on features and performance, except for the N rating, noted previously, on the first bought unit, which shows the D-Link router lives up to D-Link's words in total. Thus it's 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously poor performance & security.
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in the performance of this router given all the glowing reviews by PC Mag etc.. Not only would it not stay connected but security protocols are ineffective if it is not secured by a LAN connection. Been traveling across country & have been constantly kicked off every wifi hot spot in every motel I've stayed in. Extremely disappointing as I need to make bank transactions along the way and this router has proven to be absolutely useless. I am now getting phone calls from mortgage companies, more spam than I can block, despite setting up the security protocols as soon as I hooked it up. DO NOT BUY THIS IT DOES NOT WORK!!
customer_reviews.author: Macman

customer_reviews.title: I bought two at same time and sent both back ...
customer_reviews.text: Initial review: "I bought two at same time and sent both back for replacement. They worked for Wi-Fi sharing, but the management web page became unavailable after a short time and the red status light would light indicating the units were defective according to the manual. I am waiting to see if the replacement units work properly." -- update: It turns out that the original units worked properly with some setup changes. When I believe them to be bad, I reported that to Amazon and they promptly sent me replacements. I returned the replacements unused since they were not needed. I am very pleased with the D-Link DIR-510L portable routers and very please with Amazon customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: A great product! I travel extensively and am always annoyed with having to login to Wi-Fi Hotspots and Wired-Internet with multiple devices (multiple PCs, Tablet, iPod, and phones). With this Travel Router I can login using just one device via the Router then instantly connect my multitude of devices without having to enter in my login credentials. Comes with no Security in the Initial Setup, so I suggest you connect to your Home Network first to change the Security Settings. Once you get it Setup it is Secure, Easy, and Fast.
customer_reviews.author: Westley Anson

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for public wifi spots
customer_reviews.text: Having read about all the threats out there for getting your personal information stolen, I purchased this item. The main reason was to use it on the public WiFi networks out there, like coffee shops, hotels when traveling etc. The secondary reason was the charging ability for your device(s). I found it easy to set up and like the feature of being able to add a guest. It was easy to set up and use. Just be sure to change the master password during setup and you will be good to go. So far it has lived up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Z

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get to work
customer_reviews.text: i had this delivered 2015 July 22 It initially worked when I logged into my home system, which happens to be a d-link router Dir 890L, the space ship. I went on the road. Tried to set up using a hotel unsecured wifi. Couldn't make it work. Tried to make it work at home. NADA. Tried to get support. NADA. Tried to reset. NADA. OVERALL I FEAR I HAVE BEEN SCREWED OUT OF THE PRICE. VERY DISAPPOINTING. Might make an attractive paperweight, but I do not use paper.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ronald K. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Really cool travel accessory - Great for streaming video from hotel wireless
customer_reviews.text: Really nifty! Works better, faster, and more reliably than comparable "WiFi as WAN" devices. I travel with this. Not only does this allow me to access the hotel wireless with a limitless number of devices; it also allows me to stream Netflix, Hulu, and other movie sources directly to either an Apple TV (which I used to travel with), or to a Chromecast or MeegoPad mini-PC. (You need this device's built-in browser to configure the Apple TV correctly.)
customer_reviews.author: B&H

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different one - $100 down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Unit became defective within 4 months - battery light stuck on red, and wouldn't reliably connect to wi-fi networks. DLink expects me to pay for return shipment. But they are kind enough to offer to let me pay up to 50% of the price of the unit for expedited return shipping (but they won't say how long it'll take for them to 'inspect' the unit. It's actually cheaper for me to just buy a different brand than to return the one to DLink. I'll never buy another of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: BitBrain

customer_reviews.title: Great router for travel
customer_reviews.text: Great router for travel. I was working in a remote location in romania. the local isp at the work site used IP base price so meant one device at a time. this router help me avoid paying for connecting my ipad, iphone and laptop. i have used it at many hotels to connect my family devices to one hotspot. excellent speed and connection always. i also liked that it can Dlink app will broadcast the movies on my memory stick to my devices.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Sinning

customer_reviews.title: Great device with mediocre battery life
customer_reviews.text: This thing works awesome and would have gotten a 5 except the battery life is deplorable. I used to have the hootoo tripmate tm05 which could go all day, this thing is maybe 3 hrs. It is a real shame because the ui is great, it is a good looking device and it is way faster than the HooToo , but it wont last for a cross country flight.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: This is a high quality product and and I am very happy with the D-Link
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different portable routers. The HooToo Tripmate Elite and this one. The HooToo couldn't get past the 7mbps on a 350mbps connection while the D-Link hit 100 plus mbps down every time with a 25mbps up. This is a high quality product and and I am very happy with the D-Link. The HooToo is on its way back.
customer_reviews.author: Jvette

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm reluctant to connect devices directly to hotel networks when I do not know what else is on the network. Before, I took a couple of extra devices along to act as a router, but never invested in a true travel router before. I'm pretty happy with this one so far. Pros: Dual band (2.5/5 GHz), reasonably easy configuration, compact, includes charging feature (this let me put this device in my bag and get rid of an extra battery, so no net change in weight), very flexible (configure as router, repeater, or with cellular modem), includes wired port. Cons: Nothing big so far. I have not experienced the flakiness problems others have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this, but the ac speeds aren't any faster ...
customer_reviews.text: I travel 3 out of 4 weeks every month. I really wanted to like this, but the ac speeds aren't any faster than my other 802.11n mobile routers. The speed of attached USB storage is slightly slower. Online reviews have gotten a little faster ac speeds, but I can seem to match. I've switched back to the Netgear mobile router because it matches my home router.
customer_reviews.author: G. Texas

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK AS A ROUTER WITH USB STICK LISTED AS "SUPPORTED"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use with my Novatel USB551L internet stick. The USB551L is specifically listed in the list published on the Dlink website as a supported dongle for the DIR-510L. See list here: [...] I posted the document from the Dlink website here that shows the Novatel USB551L as a supported dongle. However, after an exhaustive personal effort to get the DIR-510L to work with the USB551L and then several calls to Dlink customer support, I was told that the DIR-510L does not support the USB551L. Then why is it listed as a "supported dongle"?? I am very disappointed with the product after it won't perform as the manufacturer claims.
customer_reviews.author: NYSDOT R1 Traffic

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget
customer_reviews.text: Took this Portable Router with me to Costa Rica where I stayed at hotel for 3 weeks. Had this turned on the whole time I was there. Only twice did I have to reconnect to Hotel's wifi but the rest of my stay it was rock solid. Had my Laptop and my phone connected to it with no problem. Setup was pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: A. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, beautiful AP...
customer_reviews.text: Still testing the battery life. Very easy and intuitive web portal. Very fast N & AC speeds. Last firmware upgrade was in April 2015. Pro: 5ghz & 2ghz range Range control File Server permissions Captcha Admin Login Con: not wpa2 enterprise compatible Only two usb 2.0 no usb 3.0
customer_reviews.author: Peter P.

customer_reviews.title: A good evolution from the DIR-506L
customer_reviews.text: I have used the DIR-506L for many years and couldn't be happier. Now, with more gadgets to carry around that need power I bought the AC750 with charging capability. So far the device works great and the latest firmware proves to be stable. Yes, compared to the DIR-506L the interface is much more simpler with less tweaks. Honestly, I haven't used them too often, so no miss for me.
customer_reviews.author: The A

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and works
customer_reviews.text: Have used mostly as a router when travelling as have a charger but router was easy to set up and have never had an issue connecting or staying connected. Not sure how much additional protection it provides as while connection to router is secured is the connection between the router and the wifi host secure?
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: good portable router and charger but falls short of 5 star territory
customer_reviews.text: If only it could charge my iPad. Other than that I love this portable router and charger. The fact it remembers previous hotshots is an unexpected plus. Sometimes it fails to connect once i power back on to same hotshot but I power off then on and it connects. Small inconvenience but cost 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Racer986

customer_reviews.title: Slow charging
customer_reviews.text: The USB ports only support standard USB with 0.5 amps. Not enough these days with most phones wanting higher power for quicker charging. As a travel device, it is more important to me to have an emergency charger that can charge my phone quickly when it ran out of juice than AC instead of a N router. Going back to my old 2 year old Lifetrons charger/router.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Good portable router
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I've needed it for. I did have some difficulty trying to set it up to repeat a wireless signal, but plugging it in to a wired Ethernet connection has worked great. I do wish there were more granular configuration options.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use. Battery charge comes in handy at times. Needs Wireless to Wired Bridging
customer_reviews.text: Used one week for vacation and loved it. It worked great. Fast and easy to use. Also it came in handy one day at home when our electric went out with a low cell phone battery. Only thing, I wish it also allowed Wireless to Wired bridging.
customer_reviews.author: mrbasicshark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Saved me so many times from being on ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Saved me so many times from being on the same network as 25,000 other people at VMworld 2015 in San Francisco. I also used this at my hotel for 5 days and it is truly the best of all of the travel routers in the market to date.
customer_reviews.author: Trusted Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Love this portable Wi-Fi router
customer_reviews.text: I've had several portable routers over the years, and the D-Link Wi-Fi AC750 is the easiest to configure of all of them. I literally pulled the unit out of the packaging, plugged it in and BOOM it worked. The set-up is very intuitive and easy to follow. My only complaint is that the power supply has a removable US outlet plug, but a European plug wasn't included. That having been said, this is a very nice unit and I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Beary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the road and air warriors out there.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Outstanding device. So far, though only a week so far, it has worked flawlessly. I am very pleased, yet again, with D-Link and their thoughtful designs and quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I have only currently used this at home to boost my home WiFi. Was very easy to setup. I have modified settings from my iPad, iPhone and Windows PC. I have tried out the file sharing function and found it very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: D. James

customer_reviews.title: It took me a couple hours to figure-out I needed ...
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple hours to figure-out I needed to create a new profile for each new wireless connection. I must say the performance is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Family

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for traveling. It allows me to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for traveling. It allows me to connect devices to hotel wifi with splashscreens on devices that do not have capability for a splashscreen (Chromecast, gameboy ect).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love D-Link
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I wish the software it came with was better for media and I wish the router itself came with more security functions. Like that of the actual router.
customer_reviews.author: SAO

customer_reviews.title: Great for Traveling Where Hotels Still limit the number of WiFI devices to make money...
customer_reviews.text: Great for use in Hotels where they continue to charge (internationally) for more than 2 devices of wifi... Battery charger for a device is a great back up.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Campos Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, lacks a few advanced features, but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love this device, works extremely well - and works all day long. Only reason for 4 not 5 is that the setup options are very limited in the GUI, making it less versatile than I'd like (such as desire for a static ip)
customer_reviews.author: DCH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: It's a router, and a charger! I never had to use the charger portion of the device, but the device was a stress reliever and a money saver while traveling cross-country with my family. Once it was set up, and everybody had saved the network connection, then every night I was connect the device to the hotel WiFi and everybody was ready to go. No need to set up multiple devices for multiple people. And in hotels that charged per connection, this turned in a money saver as well. Well worth it to anybody that travels alot, or just travels as a family occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Dana D. Charter

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as expected, I bought it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as expected, I bought it for a 6 week trip in an RV across America. Ended up not using it and was to late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: When it works its awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Resets and drops constantly. And every time I need to reset it, I have to go through the process to reconnect everything to it. Not as reliable as I'd hoped. When it works its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Corn

customer_reviews.title: Good router and power bank
customer_reviews.text: Good router and power bank, useless as WiFi based file hub. I will stick with Ravpower FileHub and Asus Wl-330nul for my travel needs. If the file copy was robust this would be my replacement for two devices to one. I wanted the greater WiFi range that the AC750 offered and wrongly assumed that the WiFi file copy would work and an easy engineering addition. WiFi copy implementation appears to be afterthought. .
customer_reviews.author: Scott Woiwode

customer_reviews.title: This device is extremely handy. On a recent trip ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is extremely handy. On a recent trip I used it in the hotel to set up a private network. This allowed me to stream content to the TV using my Chromecast. The internal battery storage allowed me to recharge my mobile devices on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good in general
customer_reviews.text: Good in general! As a wifi router work ok. Buggy firmware. Using external storage on teh USB ports will cause random failures (restart needed) USB sharing only possible with app or via webinterface. Both options are not very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Calin

customer_reviews.title: Ill be taking a vacation in a couple of weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: Ill be taking a vacation in a couple of weeks so I will put this to the test, It appears that it is working well at this time.
customer_reviews.author: HAL

customer_reviews.title: Range matches speed not so good..
customer_reviews.text: Range matches speed not so good.... The file upload feature is essentially useless on iOS Privetr for what it does
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hirsh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool unit
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool unit. I have used it to connect to wifi signals, then secure the router to my passcode. The fact that it is also a charger, makes it even more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Dodd A. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly out of the box. The range was ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly out of the box. The range was less than my PC, ie my pc could connect to a wifi signal when the D-link AC750 couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Bier

customer_reviews.title: ... to work with my verizon modem and support was pathetic..
customer_reviews.text: returned it as I could not get it to work with my verizon modem and support was pathetic....don't buy this, go with Cradlepoint instead
customer_reviews.author: SirCarlos

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but still have issues with D-Link website set up.
customer_reviews.author: actionman2u

customer_reviews.title: did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: i could not get this to work with my macbook, or a laptop PC. sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: cutter23

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Router/Charger
customer_reviews.text: The D-Link Systems Wi-Fi AC750 Portable Router and Charger (DIR-510-L) is good but not what I expected. I have no evidence that it serves as a hot spot with out side support.
customer_reviews.author: Charles O. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice router, however not connecting to some hotspots.
customer_reviews.text: I have the AC750 in use for about two months now and mostly it works great. However, it does not connect to some hotspots for some reason. It simply does not see this hotspot (SSID enabled) which I do see with my iPhone and iPad. I checked several forums for more people with this problem, but no luck so far. Whenever it connects to a hotspot, hotel hotspot or so, it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Luc's review

customer_reviews.title: Paperweight, save the box as you are going to end up returning it
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a day. I have now taken it on my first trip, and cant log onto the unit through either dlinkrouter.local. or the IP. Tried from multiple devices.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: and wires mac book get good downloads much faster
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly fist time I use it to extend and increased my WiFi signal from the master bedroom to all the rooms in the house. No boxy package mess in the kitchen. Win 10, and wires mac book get good downloads much faster.
customer_reviews.author: robert j. broderick

customer_reviews.title: Not a great router
customer_reviews.text: I had this thing plugged into an iPad charger in the car and it couldn't keep it from depleting the charge. The software is terrible. Sharing app is terrible. I really wanted this to be a car router that hosted music and videos via the Usb stick plugged into it for kids to watch on iPads. It works for that... But only barely. The software is terrible and won't recognize movies in the app so I had to use a web interface. The router software is terrible and came in chinese at first. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stiles

customer_reviews.title: probably another waste of money
customer_reviews.text: wanted to use it primarily as a hotspot. carlos at tech support walked me through the nuances of setting it up (agent ar004279) worked for a while - keeps dropping signal. putting too much time in making it work Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: ar004639 I have had some problems with getting on the ...
customer_reviews.text: ar004639 I have had some problems with getting on the internet, I called d link an was assisted by Alan he walked me t hrough the problem and fixed it. I,'m giving him 5 stars for his ability and for putting up with my slowness on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: j.hiet

customer_reviews.title: works like charm. I get 75 mbs on this little ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, works like charm. I get 75 mbs on this little thing. Great for trips.
customer_reviews.author: Alon Sabi

customer_reviews.title: ... item is a must have and they have a great customer support team any questions on how to get ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a must have and they have a great customer support team any questions on how to get your d link started just give them a call
customer_reviews.author: louis whetsell

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fast and very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast and very easy to setup. Hooked it up to a Lan connection in our den and everyone lives how fast we can IPad surf in that room now. Works really well when traveling and staying in hotels as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: With an iPhone that seems to eat its battery life for lunch, and an iPad that I refuse to pay VZW for data service, this is the perfect solution. Back-up batter for the iPhone? Check. Hotspot for iPad (without draining my iPhone battery)? Check. A design that looks to be consistent with all my iDevices? Check. User interface seems to be fairly intuitive. I'll try to check back in later once I've had more time to use this handy device in my day-to-day activities.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: 👍😎👌
customer_reviews.text: Love It❗️ Works Really well, easy to set up 👍
customer_reviews.author: TonyG

customer_reviews.title: Great little router!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little router works great! It was very easy to setup and secure the wireless!!! I use it when I travel to connect iPhone, Surface book, iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rated the Best Overall by Comparrison
customer_reviews.text: It was pricier by $60, but a computer magazine rated this unit as a far superior stand alone portable modem in it's own class. Compare stats between this unit & it's competitors. You'll see that the extra money spent was way more worth it! More advanced for this era hands down.
customer_reviews.author: treker53

customer_reviews.title: While I love D-Links and my Dir-890-L kicks major tail
customer_reviews.text: While I love D-Links and my Dir-890-L kicks major tail. This one is lacking in the feature department as AP/Routers go. I know it's a travel router, but when you can't even set a password or use one for the network you connect to longer than 15 characters there is a problem with your code.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work For Me...
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this router to connect to my Dell laptop or my Asus desktop, no matter how hard I tried (and I'm tech-savvy). I had to return this D-Link. (Since returning this router, I've purchased a TP-Link Portable 3G/4G Wireless N Router from Amazon that works perfectly.)
customer_reviews.author: Carl J...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent results. fast enough to run a remote office. The wifi connection to a Wan is an excellent feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great device - Highly recommend for the traveler or people who do demos!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Curran

customer_reviews.title: Close, but no dice.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but mine keeps resetting to factory defaults and the media server has been too finniky.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent so far. I have only used it a couple of times but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: John T Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with USB551L modem
customer_reviews.text: I ran into the same issue as another reviewer on here. I am using the Novatel USB551L modem which is on the list as being "supported" and it will not work. I have done all the troubleshooting with tech support with updating firmware doing a factory reset and it still will not work with the dongle. I am returning the router since it won't work as advertised. If you have the USB551L modem, stay away!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Magroin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, setup, and convenient. Would be nice if it has a case or sleeve of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Chipman

customer_reviews.title: Great portable AC router
customer_reviews.text: Works Extremely well. There are more compact routers out there, but I have had no issues with range or interference with this one. Very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Norr

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.  Bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Easy to setup. Finish of product is a little iffy in some spots. All in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Gets really hot when in use. Charges slower than most.
customer_reviews.author: Gobears85

customer_reviews.title: NOT as secure as stated ...
customer_reviews.text: While the link from your device to this router IS completely secure AND it keeps others on the same wifi service out of your device - the link from the router to/from the wifi service is JUST as open and "snoopable" as if this weren't being used. Device description by D-Link COULD have been a bit more honest.
customer_reviews.author: Ted de Castro

customer_reviews.title: Very limited use so far but it works right out ...
customer_reviews.text: Very limited use so far but it works right out of the box. No problems hooking up to Ipad & Galaxy Tablet
customer_reviews.author: Carl Izumi

customer_reviews.title: Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: The right item with the expected delivery date.....very good... Thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Loiselle

customer_reviews.title: Low transfer speeds
customer_reviews.text: Overall the hardware and software look good and I was enthusiastic about the product. Unfortunately, in testing it I found that it has horrible transfer rates. I connected it to an Airport Extreme AC wifi router with 30 mbps internet connectivity. Connection went fine, but I'm getting a transfer rate of only about 1.5 mbps when connecting via 801.11ac and < 1 mbps when connecting via 801.11n. When I use a similar product from another vendor, I'm seeing transfer speeds of 20 mbps. This is a fatal flow for my usage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: D-Link Systems Wi-Fi AC750 Portable Router and Charger (DIR-510L)
product_meta.description:
WI-FI AC750 PORTABLE ROUTER AND CHARGER
Connect, share and charge your mobile devices anytime, anywhere. Share files, stream media and browse the Internet with the reliability and performance provided by Next-Generation Wireless AC technology. Simply connect your laptop, smartphone, or tablet to the DIR-510L’s wireless network and it will take care of the rest. A built-in, high-capacity rechargeable battery, allows for on-the-go charging of all your mobile devices.

Create an instant Wi-Fi hotspot or boost weak wireless signal Share a single Internet connection with all of your devices and avoid "per device" feesView larger Transform public hotspot into a secure private Wi-Fi network Access your media on your USB drive at home or remotelyView larger Charge your mobile devices on-the-go Enjoy 11AC wireless speeds of up to 300 + 433Mbps 
FEATURES
 * Device Connectivity: Easy sharing of your wireless hotspot or your 3G/4G LTE Internet connection
 * Next-Generation 11AC Wi-Fi: Wireless speeds of up to 300 + 433Mbps
 * Simultaneous Dual Band: Uninterrupted performance no matter what you are doing
 * File Sharing: Stream your media from anywhere with the mydlink SharePort
 * Mobile Power Station: Charge your mobile devices on the go with the built-in, high capacity 4000 mAh rechargeable battery



AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Connect all of your devices to the Internet
Charge your mobile devices with a re-chargeable 4000mAh battery
Share a single Wi-Fi or Ethernet connection. Create your own private personal cloud storage with mydlink SharePort.
**VERY IMPORTANT**Please Note: Kindly refer the User Manual and the User Guide before use.

specifications.Operating System: PC; MAC; ios; android; Window Phone
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars191 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
